big_picture_notes: James is a Christianized wisdom letter employing diatribe, vivid imagery, and catchword links to weave a ring‑like composition. Its backbone is moral dualities (hearing/doing, rich/lowly, earthly/heavenly wisdom, faith/works), with brief, self‑contained exhortation units ideal for memorization. The argument cycles from steadfastness under trial to impartial love and active faith, to tongue/wisdom/peace, and concludes with prophetic warning and pastoral practices (patience, prayer, restoration). Inclusios include 1:1 with 5:19–20 and repeated catchwords (peirasmos, glōssa, dikaios).

stories.story_title: Enduring Trials and the Perfect Gift
stories.why_start_end_and_literary_glue: Start (1:1) superscription opens; end (1:18) resolves trial/temptation by affirming God as giver who brings forth by the word of truth. Glue: peirasmos repetition (1:2, 1:12), rich/lowly contrast, and giver/gift theme culminating in the Father of lights (1:17).

scenes.scene_name: The Joy of Enduring the Test of Faith
scenes.why_start_end_and_devices: Salutation; count it all joy; testing→steadfastness→complete. Devices: imperative thesis, logical chain, trial motif.
Ask for wisdom; doubter like sea‑wave; double‑minded unstable. Devices: conditional promise, simile of surf, dipsychos warning.

scenes.scene_name: True Exaltation and the Rich Man’s Fading
scenes.why_start_end_and_devices: Lowly boast; rich fade like flower scorched by sun. Devices: reversal contrast, withering flora simile.

scenes.scene_name: The Source of Sin and the Perfect Father
scenes.why_start_end_and_devices: Blessed the steadfast; God tempts no one; desire conceives sin; every good gift from unchanging Father; brought forth by word of truth. Devices: beatitude, contrast God vs temptation, creation/birth imagery.

stories.story_title: The Royal Law and the True Nature of Faith
stories.why_start_end_and_literary_glue: Start (1:19) ‘Know this…’ pivots to ethical reception of the word; end (2:26) clinches faith/works with body/spirit analogy. Glue: word/hear/do triad (1:21–25), impartiality vs royal law, and diatribe with exempla showing living faith.

scenes.scene_name: Receive the Word; Put Away Filth
scenes.why_start_end_and_devices: Quick to hear, slow to speak/anger; receive implanted word. Devices: triple imperative, moral preparation metaphor.

scenes.scene_name: Hearers and Doers of the Word
scenes.why_start_end_and_devices: Be doers not hearers; mirror forgetfulness vs perfect law perseverance. Devices: mirror simile, blessed doer conclusion.
Bridle tongue; visit orphans/widows; keep unstained. Devices: concise merism of piety (social and personal).
No favoritism; rich vs poor seating test; have you not made distinctions? Devices: vivid hypothetical, probing question.
God chose the poor rich in faith; rich oppress and blaspheme. Devices: contrastive reproof, honor‑name theme.
Love your neighbor; stumble in one law = guilty of all; mercy triumphs. Devices: legal logic, royal law, mercy/judgment aphorism.
What good is faith without works? Naked/hungry example; faith alone is dead. Devices: diatribe Q, social illustration, dead‑faith verdict.
Imaginary objector; Abraham and Rahab justify by works; body/spirit analogy. Devices: diatribe exchange, paired exempla, inclusio with 2:17.

stories.story_title: The Control of Speech and the Two Wisdoms
stories.why_start_end_and_literary_glue: Start (3:1) stricter judgment for teachers introduces tongue discourse; end (4:12) sole Lawgiver/Judge closes the judging/slander unit. Glue: glōssa references (3:2,5,6,8), power‑similes, and the heavenly vs earthly wisdom contrast feeding the conflict/resolution sequence.

scenes.why_start_end_and_devices: Few should teach; we all stumble; perfect man controls whole body. Devices: concise admonition, speech‑control criterion.

scenes.scene_name: Power and Indictment of the Tongue
scenes.why_start_end_and_devices: Bit, rudder, fire—small organ great power; untamable, deadly. Devices: triple similes, escalating indictment.
Blessing and cursing from same mouth; fountain/fig/grape analogies. Devices: rhetorical questions, nature analogies exposing inconsistency.
Who is wise? Show by meekness; earthly envy vs heavenly purity/peace. Devices: contrast list, chiasm, sevenfold virtues, harvest of righteousness.

scenes.scene_name: Source of War and Way to Grace
scenes.why_start_end_and_devices: Quarrels arise from passions; you ask wrongly; God gives more grace—opposes proud, gives grace to humble. Devices: diatribe Q&A, proverb citation.
Submit, resist, draw near… lament—then He will exalt. Devices: rapid imperative chain, humility promise.

scenes.scene_name: The Sin of Judging a Brother
scenes.why_start_end_and_devices: Do not speak evil; one Lawgiver and Judge. Devices: concise prohibition, climactic rhetorical question.

stories.story_title: Warnings, Patience, and the Power of Prayer
stories.why_start_end_and_literary_glue: Start (4:13) ‘Come now…’ oracle formula opens woes; end (5:20) restoration maxim seals the pastoral close. Glue: paired ‘Come now’ addresses (4:13; 5:1), patience to the Lord’s coming, prayer/healing practice, and communal restoration goal.

scenes.why_start_end_and_devices: You who say ‘today/tomorrow’—life is a mist; to omit known good is sin. Devices: prophetic address, vapor metaphor, omission‑sin maxim.
Weep and howl; riches rot, rust testifies; you condemned the righteous. Devices: prophetic woe, decay imagery, hyperbolic judgment.
Be patient until the Lord comes; farmer, prophets, Job as models. Devices: agrarian analogy, repetition of patience, eschatological motive.
Above all do not swear; let yes be yes, no be no. Devices: absolute prohibition, concise maxim.

scenes.scene_name: The Practice and Power of Prayer
scenes.why_start_end_and_devices: Suffer? pray; cheerful? praise; sick? elders/prayer/anoint; Elijah’s effective prayer. Devices: condition‑response triad, communal rite, exemplum of Elijah.
If anyone wanders, bring him back; cover a multitude of sins. Devices: restoration inclusio with opening themes, salvation payoff.
